name: The Glenburn Hotel & Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Glenburn Hotel, we stayed for 3 nights starting on a friday. turning up at 1430hrs to a warm welcome and a quick explanation of diner times etc was nice. We like our weekends away and tend to have a long weekend every couple of months, so we've had experience of the good; bad; and the ugly. The Glenburn falls into the good catagory for us overall.
reviews.title: VERY GOOD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good points? location was good, the hotel is on the way out of town heading south. The food and service were good. There is on site parking. The hotel is very clean and tidy. And the hotel is licensed so an evening drink with diner or in the lounge is handy, there is only 1 draft lager and 1 draft beer but the spirits are well stocked and there is also a reasonable wine list. The staff are very attentive, keen to be helpfull and very hard working. Perhaps sometimes a little too attentive, on several occasions over breakfast and diner my plate was whipped away while i was still chewing my last mouthfull. But overall, very good. Certainly a very high standard of service. The food was well prepared and presented, i asked for a medium rare steak and got a medium rare steak, and it was a very good piece of meat too. I can highly reccommend the Thia fishcakes, the Lasagne, Salmon and the breakfast were all superb. With a very varied choice for breakfast. Pricing is very good, we stayed 3 nights with breakfast and ate diner every night, with evening drinks for just over £400, thats not bad at all.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: The hotel is very popular, with the Friday and Saturday nights very busy, i dont think they were far off fully booked, given the time of year and the economy i think that bodes well.
reviews.title: Very nice stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa bath is a nice touch as is the little note asking you to be aware that other guests are staying and the spa is a little noisy, so not to use after 2230hrs. The bathroom is spacious and well appointed, nicely tiled,with plenty of hot water. The room was warm, with double glazing and nice thick heavy curtains. Not too much road noise either. We did hear other guests coming up stairs, you always do, but again; it was not too obtrusive with good carpeting and soft closing doors.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very nice, well run, clean, tidy, popular, well located hotel. Offering very good food, and above average accomodation at a very reasonable price. Will we stay there again?.Yes i think so.
reviews.title: nice break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions were "a bit old fashioned" but clean which is the main thing. Staff were so friendly and helpful. We stayed for evening meal and we couldnt fault it. The food was lovely, service was fantastic and it really was a beautiful stay. My only complaint would be ... we stayed in a room where we could hear every word and footstep coming from the room above. Location was great 10 min walk down to the Lake at Bowness and a short walk to the restaurants and bars. A small car park out the back but very safe.
reviews.title: Nice friendly hotel - fantastic food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A small and compact hotel whose features rate far more than its two-star rating. From the cheerful and friendly welcome of mine Hostess Jackie to the thoughtful touches found in our room makes this hotel outstanding. Its comfortable and elegant surroundings, immaculate and friendly service and freshly-prepared meals in the restaurant make staying here a pleasantly memorable experience.
reviews.title: An absolute jewel of an hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convenient to Lakeside and National Park attractions the whole delightful ambience of this hotel makes one yearn to return and linger for a longer break - if our travels bring us back to the Lake District we would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: One to return to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Our congratulations and thanks to Jackie, her husband and the excellent staff for this delightful short stay in Windermere
reviews.title: Warm and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We arrived Fri 25th March in lovely sunshine to be warmly welcomedby the very friendly staff. The room was very comfortable and the bed was delightful. Centrally located between Windermere and Bowness a short walk and you were in either village.
reviews.title: Comfortable, warm, and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel, clean beautifully decorated and appointed rooms. Staff were very friendly and efficient and the food was just wonderful......locally produced and superbly cooked.
reviews.title: Recommended..a wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On Saturday afternoon free scones and coffee were provided which was a really lovely touch.
reviews.title: excellent lakeland hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We will definitely go again and would recommend The Glenburn to anyone wanting a lovely place to stay in the Lakes.
reviews.title: value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Riverside Cottage with woodland and a stream running at the back .A wood pecker and squirrels spotted on our last visit . location is excellent for fell walking or just motoring round the lakes .We have visited the Glenburn Hotel many times and will return again soon . The food is excellent and always presented well .The owners Jackie ,Peter and the staff always very polite and make your stay very pleasant .A warm welcome awaits .
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: owner and staff friendly food excellent will return later this year
reviews.title: Basic Hotel Not As It Shows On Website

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful surprise stay here for Valentines' Day booked my husband , Hotel has parking to front and rear of hotel . And is near to lake and shops , about 5mins by car. Was greeted by the friendly lady owner who asked us what time we would like our valentines ' dinner served ! . She showed us to our room which had a gorgeous four poster bed scattered with rose petals with a teddy and flowers and chocolates , all arranged by my hubby but very kindly and considerately arranged by the owner which was a lovely touch . The room was very nicely decorated , clean and roomy . Bathroom has bath with spa facility and shower , heated towel rail and was very clean and modern . Had an excellant three course meal in a delightfully decorated dining room ( Valentine theme ) All in all a great stay . Highly recommended
reviews.title: WONDERFUL HOSPITALITY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We booked this Hotel through the Internet, And from making the booking to the first call to the owners jackie/peter baister. of the glenburn hotel,We were well assured of a good quality hotel. the prices were so good we decided to stay for the whole week-end......The Hotel was excellent. From Reception to the friendly staff showing us to our room, nothing was to much trouble for them to make our stay a week-end to remember.... The breakfast was a great buffet of cereals, juices, yoghurts, and all included if you desired the full English breakfast ....From Scrambled egg, poached.or even the good old fried egg. We do how-ever wish we had stayed to eat our evening meal at the Glenburn as the menu"s looked tempting.But being on a week-end away we went out to windemere for meals ,later to regret not eating at the hotel,.and the nice ambience of the hotel bar ..... THE GLENBURN also has prices to The Cottage at the back of the hotel which look"s great to stay at on the riverside the And pets go FREE........ ... thank you again Jackie/Peter...... From Kurt /Mike ... Shropshire
reviews.title: Home From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Small hotel was a little gem, we booked it on a whim and we weren.t diappointed. Everywhere was clean and the staff very polite and attentive. The room was just right. The hearty breakfast was just that. I would have no hesitation in recommending or returning to this hotel.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Girls are great food top notch very clean good location realy enjoyed our stay would recomend to anyone wanting a break.
reviews.title: fab

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 days was not enough.
reviews.title: good service, good food, good value

description: Highly acclaimed non smoking hotel with free leisure facilities, just 5 minutes walk from Windermere, new deluxe rooms with jacuzzi spa baths & rain showers, four poster beds, family rooms, self catering cottages, free parking, great restaurant & bar, just totally refubished to a high standard, outstanding in every way.
